answers.text: a period when European ideas in classical physics, astronomy, biology, human anatomy, chemistry, and other classical sciences were rejected

qas.question: What did the Scientific Revolution cause?
What did the Scientific Revolution force people to do?

context: The Scientific Revolution was <a0_0>a period when European ideas in classical physics, astronomy, biology, human anatomy, chemistry, and other classical sciences were rejected<a0_0/> and led to doctrines supplanting those that had prevailed from Ancient Greece to the Middle Ages which would lead to <a1_0>a transition to modern science<a1_0/>. This period saw a fundamental transformation in scientific ideas across physics, astronomy, and biology, in institutions supporting scientific investigation, and in the more widely held picture of the universe. Individuals started to <a2_0>question all manners of things<a2_0/> and it was this questioning that led to the Scientific Revolution, which in turn formed the foundations of contemporary sciences and the establishment of <a3_0>several modern scientific fields.
